comments:
I've gotten this twice, but I can't seem to reproduce it consistently.  Created
two projects, in one created a new shell. In the second created a new jframe. 
Error occured sometime during the load of the jframe.

Created an attachment (id=20250)
Bean Info Error
This occured with our latest nightly driver N20050422.

Still getting this in N20050524, still random... this time it happened while in
the New Visual Class wizard while no classes were open in the VE.
... assume this is going to be fixed with the cleanup of the cache/clean builder

I'm releasing this as a dup because I think it occurred due to those reasons. If
it occurs again, please reopen this defect.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 101888 ***

I received this again randomly in the latest VE build I20050707.  I was working
on a fresh workspace and fresh install between two different files in two
different projects.  Here are the steps, but i'm pretty sure they don't have any
effect on it.

1) Create project SmokeTest02
2) Create project SmokeTest03
3) Create new JFrame in SmokeTest02 and build SayHello application. Close.
4) Create new Shell in SmokeTest03.
5) The first drop I tried triggered this exception below:

java.io.FileNotFoundException:
D:\workspaces\eclipse3.1\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.resources\.projects\SmokeTest03\org.eclipse.jem.beaninfo\.cache\.index
(The system cannot find the path specified)
at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method)
at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:179)
at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:131)
at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.beaninfo.core.BeanInfoCacheController$SaveParticipant.writeIndex(BeanInfoCacheController.java:1320)
at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.beaninfo.core.BeanInfoCacheController$SaveParticipant.saving(BeanInfoCacheController.java:1305)
at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.executeLifecycle(SaveManager.java:324)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager$1.run(SaveManager.java:153)
at
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform.run(InternalPlatform.java:1044)
at org.eclipse.core.runtime.Platform.run(Platform.java:783)
at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.broadcastLifecycle(SaveManager.java:156)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.SaveManager.save(SaveManager.java:957)
at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.DelayedSnapshotJob.run(DelayedSnapshotJob.java:44)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

Thanks for the additional info. Finally figured out what is going on. It is a
weird race condition. 

The cache is structured as follows:

.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.resources\.projects\SmokeTest03\org.eclipse.jem.beaninfo\
  .cache\
      .index
      rootn\
        aclass.xmi <- the override file.

Normally only .metadata\...\org.eclipse.jem.beaninfo\ directories would be
created by default.

Now the index file is written only on snapshots which Eclipse does a five minute
intervals, while the aclass.xmi is written one minute after the content has been
changed in memory. Normally the aclass.xmi file will be written first because
one minute is less than five minutes. Whent the aclass.xmi file is written it
uses EMF to write it. EMF is smart enough to create all of the intervening
directories if they are not yet created. But the write of the index doesn't do
that, it just writes it. So normally by the time the write index occurs the
write of the aclass.xmi file has occurred and the directories are there. But if
the five minute snapshot interval ends before the one minute aclass interval
ends, then it tries to do the the writeIndex before the directories have been
created and so fails.

Since this is a race condition and the normal case is the other way around I was
never able to figure out what was going on because whenever I looked at it
everything seemed like it should work. But now with this additional info I see
what's going on and I can add the necessary code to create the directories for
writeIndex too.
The fix has been released to HEAD.
I thought it marked it fixed.
Looks good, haven't seen it since the fix.  Closing for VE 1.1.

traces.message: D:\workspaces\eclipse3.1\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.resources\.projects\SmokeTest03\org.eclipse.jem.beaninfo\.cache\.index (The system cannot find the path specified)
